Let \(f(x)=\dfrac{4x^{2}-3x+1}{\displaystyle \int_{0}^{2\pi x}\!\sin^{4} t\,dt}\). If \(f'\!\left(\tfrac{1}{2}\right)=\dfrac{p}{q\pi}\) with \(p,q\in\mathbb{N}\), then \((p-q)\) equals
If \(\int e^{\,1-\cos x}\,(1+x\sin x)\,dx=f(x)-e^{\,1-g(x)}+c\), then the number of solutions of the equation \(|f(x)|=g(x)\) equals \((c\text{ is arbitrary})\).

Let \(\int \dfrac{x-\sin x\cos x}{x^{2}\cos^{2} x}\,dx=F(x)\) with \(F(1)=1\). Then \(\displaystyle \lim_{x\to 0}F(x)\) equals

If \(I_1=\int_{0}^{\pi}\dfrac{\cos x}{(x+2)^2}\,dx\), \(I_2=\int_{0}^{\pi/2}\dfrac{\cos x\,\sin x}{x+1}\,dx\) and \(\lambda I_2=\dfrac{2}{\mu+\pi}+k-\gamma I_1\), then which of the following are correct?

A function \(f\) satisfies \[2+\int_{2}^{x} f'(t)\,dt=\frac{x^{2}}{2}+\int_{x}^{2} t^{2} f'(t)\,dt.\] Then the number of real solutions of the equation \(x^{2}-2x+2(1-f(x))=0\) is \(n\). Then \(n\) is a factor of

Let \(f\) be twice differentiable and satisfy\[ f''(t)=\int_{12t}^{t^{3}+6t^{2}} \ln\!\left|\frac{x+8}{(t+2)^{3}-x}\right| dx\quad \forall t\in\mathbb{R},\]\nwith \(f(1)=2f(2)=2\). Find \(\displaystyle \int_{-1}^{1} f(x)\,dx\).
If \(A=\int_{0}^{101} \lfloor |x|\rfloor\,\sin(\pi x)\,dx\), then find the value of \(\dfrac{A\pi}{2}\).
If \(\displaystyle \int_{0}^{1/2} \frac{\pi\,dx}{2\,(\cos^{-1}x)^{2}\,\sqrt{1-x^{2}}}=\frac{p}{q}\), where \(p\) and \(q\) are relatively prime, then find \(p+q\).
If \(\displaystyle \int e^{x}\!\left(\frac{1-x^{n}}{1-x}\right)dx=e^{x}P(x)+C\), where \(n\in\mathbb{N}\), \(C\) is a constant of integration and \(P(0)=620\), then find \(n\).
